Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Clazomenian, probably black-figured, pottery neck-amphora with handle root; interior reserved; exterior: silhouette palmette (part of left side with tendril reaching to handle root on far left); modelled ridge at junction of neck and shoulder with traces of black.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1863,0330.4 and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA135.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 132, no. 34)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.011) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
